title: I read a major spoiler about a series I just started. How do I get over this and enjoy the series anyway? - Quora

response.answer_text: Myself, I wouldn’t find it much of a struggle, Arnold. I’ve read a lot of books before I’ve seen the films, for example, and though some details may change, most of the major plot-points have to remain in order to carry the story. Hence, there are quite a few films for which I more or less knew the story and its likely major spoilers, but I enjoyed the films all the same. (Most of the time. You know, there’s always that risk when a book is translated to film that it’s not going to go well, lol…) In terms of television shows, a biggie would be Game of Thrones. I’d already read the first couple of books before the series began, so I was pretty sure I knew what some of the major events would be. That didn’t diminish my enjoyment of the series, though. Or to give another example, The Sopranos. I came to it late, and in the process of catching up, someone gave away the final episode to me. I watched it anyway, all the way through - there were lots of other plot twists that I didn’t know about, so there was still a lot of “story” left to explore. And for what it’s worth - I thought the ending sucked. I still think it sucks. If I’d seen it through without having an awareness of where it was going, I’d have thought the ending sucked. It’s one of the worst finales of history. But I watched it through all the same. You don’t have to “get over” it. You’re not going to forget what you now know. But that doesn’t mean watching the series through has been totally ruined. …unless the ending sucks. ;-) Thanx for the A2A, Arnold!
I would just watch the series regardless. Once you know the ending there is know way of unknowing it and so just enjoy the journey and not the destination
